name: Bed & Breakfast Speelmansrei

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here during a weekend in April. The hosts were very friendly and helpful with suggestions for walks and restaurants. The house has a pretty view on to a small garden and canal. The room was simply and elegantly furnished. The bed was amazing -- very comfortable. Breakfast was simple but adequate. All in all, we would stay here again and would recommend that others do so on their visit to Brugge.
reviews.title: Pretty house, friendly hosts, comfy bed, no complaints

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed for 3 nights over Easter 2012. The room was lovely and spacious, and the shower had awesome pressure! Breakfast was nice - although we didn't quite feel equal to the cold meat and cheese first thing in the morning, the yoghurt and toast and preserves were good. The B&B is in an great location, a very short walk to most of the main attractions. Kees and Kathleen were excellent hosts, attentive and very helpful sharing tips about where to eat and what to see, without being intrusive. Overall a lovely stay, and we would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent B&B
Very pleasant stay in Bruges
reviews.text: The bed and breakfast Speelmansrei is a very good choice when you plan a trip to Bruges. It is near the shopping streets, squares and nice terraces. The room was perfect, with a nice bed and bedroom. In addition, the owner of the B&B is very enthousiastic and recommended us some nice places to have drinks, restaurants for dinner and nice walks around town.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a fabulous B&B only 5 minute walk from the central squares but set on a quiet cobbled street. It backs onto the Canal and the photos don't do the rooms justice as the whole house has been renovated and is very beautiful. We stayed in the front bedroom and it was very spacious with a comfortable 6 foot bed, had a large bathroom and had all modcons. Breakfast was very nice and Kees could not have been more helpful, printing off cycling maps for us and giving us recommendations for lunch, dinner and a lovely walk around the smaller canals which weren't overrun with tourists. I would highly recommend this B&B.
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a lovely place to stay. The room was bright and spacious with an amazing view of the garden, canal and park. Perfect location, just a few minutes walk from the town centre. The hosts were very welcoming and had great tips on where to eat and visit. Only downside....the bed was so comfortable it was hard to get out of it :-)
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: B & B Speelmansrei is ideally situated,and is a perfect base to explore this lovely city. My spacious room overlooked the garden, canal and park, and was a peaceful retreat. Kees and Kathleen are helpful friendly hosts and as a solo traveller I felt totally at home. I will recommend it to my friends and hope to come back when it's stopped raining!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.text: A modern but stylish place with big bright and clean rooms and a great garden by the canal.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for our trip in Bruges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located on a quiet street but also in a very central location. The owner was very helpful and showed us great hospitality. We definitely recommend this place to stay when in Bruge. The price is 95 euro including breakfast and it deserves it.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We have stayed in several places in Bruges and Speelmansrei was, without a doubt, the best. Located on a quiet street just a few blocks from the main square, it offered both the convenience of location and seclusion from the noisy crowds. More like staying in a close friend's house than a hotel, this bed and breakfast offers only two rooms. Both are very large with private bathrooms. We stayed in the room overlooking the garden and canal. It offered a king size bed, wonderful bedding and an immaculate and well appointed bathroom. Kees was a perfect host, unintrusive when you desired and extremely helpful when asked questions. Breakfast was served in a quaint room on the first floor between 8:30 - 9:30 and provided a perfectly substantial start to the day. It included: eggs made to order, toasts, pastries, meats, cheeses, juices and as many freshly brewed coffees as you desired. We will definitely be back. Book early to secure one of these perfect rooms.
reviews.title: I will return someday....

reviews.text: I think this was the nicest place I've ever stayed. So clean and stylish. I loved it. My sister and I had our pick of rooms between the back canal view and the front street view. The street view won out because it was a bigger brighter room. But the canal view room was large also and we couldn't go wrong in either one.
reviews.title: Nothing short of perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Couldn't ask for better hosts, Helpful, warm and eager to meet your needs.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is surprising to find a B&B that has an elevator to accommodate guests who find stairs difficult to maneuver.
reviews.title: Marvelous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very convenient to the train station and close to all the attractions of Brugge. Would definitely return.
reviews.title: A peaceful & relaxing stay in beautiful Brugge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a beautiful room overlooking the garden and canal on a lovely quiet street just minutes from the historic center. Delicious breakfast, king-sized bed, sleek and spacious bathroom - especially appreciated coffee and tea-making supplies in the room. Kees offered us a suggested walk through the quieter side of Bruges , which was the highlight of our stay. This has to be the very best accommodation in Bruges - we would not have wanted to stay anywhere else!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed 3 days with Kees. Great location: walkable from railway station (about 20 min), 4 min to the main square, shops, laundry and supermarket all nearby. Historic 1500s house (!) with sleek modern interior. Our room was spacious, has separate bathroom with double basins and toilet, free wifi, TV, stereo, books, magazines etc etc etc everything you need. Breakfast was wonderful too. Kees was always bubbling with enthusiasm and ever so helpful with info on Brugge. We had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kees and Kathleen are wonderful hosts and have created an oasis in Bruges. From the moment you meet them you realize how much joy and pride they have in the B&B.
reviews.title: THE Place to Stay In Bruges!
Fantastic start to our trip
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights. Our room was unexpectedly large with very modern facilities. We enjoyed the fresh breezes at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were nice. Kees offered every morning to make any kind of eggs that we wanted. My wife likes hers scrambled hard and wound up in the kitchen with Kees! They had a good time.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we came back in the afternoon and evening and ran into our hosts, we chatted and it felt like we were staying at a friend's house and not a B&B. We can't thank Kees and Kathleen enough for their welcome.
reviews.title: A home away from home!

reviews.text: Sverything at this B&B was more than promised. Breakfast made to our taste, eaten on the patio by the canal, great touring advice, wonderful beds and all other facilities.
reviews.title: Perfect B&B

description: B & B GUESTROOMS – SPEELMANSREIGENERAL INFORMATION In the course of 2005 and 2006 we rebuilt two historical houses in the heart of the ancient center of Bruges.With modern comfort ad a surplus they were transformed into a single residence with B & B guestrooms.( an elevator is available).During the rebuilding we carefully respected the unique character of the houses and the centuries old rafters were integrated with the architectural concept.You will enjoy the new comfortable bathrooms made of natural raw materials, the marble floors, the basalt washing stands.A separate breakfast room is at the guests’ disposal.ROOMSThere are two rooms on the first floor with view on a park.They are both provided with shower and/ or bath, a lavatory, a washing stand with two wash-basins, colour-tv, internet, a safe and spacious double beds of top quality.Also access to the rooms by elevator. BREAKFAST In the separate breakfast room an extensive breakfast buffet is served. Every day you can get newly baked French rolls, croissants, different kinds of cheese and sliced meats, fruit juice, yoghurt, cereals etc. LANGUAGES We make ourselves hard in Dutch, French, Italian, German, English, Spanish and Danish.
